Tiffany Dixon

Creator | Coach | Advocate | Executive Director

As a female in the male-dominated cycling world, I have firsthand experienced countless challenges yet the bike has taught me perseverance and determination. I have built and run national elite-level women's and junior race teams, organized countless community bike clinics/programs, ran kid's bike programs, sat on numerous boards and committees for cycling, advocated for better practices for juniors/women, and so much more. I have seen firsthand the way a bike can literally change and save one's life. From high levels of competitive racing to an everyday means of transportation, bikes are a unique thing that positively impacts individuals and communities. My wide range of experience with bikes from high levels to grassroots drives me to give opportunities and eliminate barriers to create a more diverse cycling culture that welcomes all and will allow people to find what the bike means to them. Cyclocross is an amazingly fun way to bring people together in an open welcoming environment that can build communities and get more people involved at all ages and levels. My drive is my passion to share bikes with everyone and be the change we all want to see.

Josh Allen

Race Director | Sponsorship Coordinator

I grew up on a ranch in central Arkansas. My first experience with competition was running. I ran in college and ended up injured from over training in my first year. This was a devastating moment, but the injury led me to buy an old cyclocross bike. After racing in Colorado for 10 years I’ve returned to my roots in Arkansas. I’ve had the privilege of racing and riding my bike all over the world from some of the most iconic races like Leadville 100, Dirty Kanza 200, to the South African Absa Cap Epic stage race. I know firsthand how bikes can change lives.

I ride because I love exploring the land around me and my own physical limitations. I love to escape into the back roads of Arkansas, deep into the Ozark Mountains. However, I have come to see that it is the life long cycling friends that have made through riding my bike that has made all the difference to me over the years.

I currently live in Downtown Rogers Arkansas. I love this place. A great deal of my efforts in community development has been through cycling and its impacts on the community. I am passionate about building healthy, diverse, inclusive, communities. The bike is an incredible machine and a great tool to create a healthy culture in a community. Arkansas has a unique position right now to showcase what the bike can do for small towns.

I am excited about Allcross because it’s the type of grass roots movement in the cycling world that establishes the early history of what we are all about. What we value and who we value is established in movements like this. I want to be a part of the change. I want to hold steady to the values that Allcross represents, so we can create a healthy, diverse, and inclusive cycling community right here in NWA. Let's all ride bikes!

Jake "Fancy Pants" Schneidewind

Race Day Operations | Crew Manager

I grew up in Lowell, Arkansas. I’ve been riding bikes since I was 11 years old. I started mountain biking right before the huge NWA cycling boom, so I picked a decent time to become hooked on the sport. In 9th grade, I started road bike racing partially due to constantly catastrophically injuring myself out of my school track and cross country running career. I won my first several races, including the Joe Martin Stage race (as a cat 5), and decided cycling was my new obsession. I raced constantly all through high school, into college, and up to the present day. I was lucky enough to be able to race elite levels in road, xc mountain bike, and cyclocross through those years. I learned a lot about myself, life, training, racing, and tactics while racing bikes all across the country and internationally. I took a bit of a hiatus from racing a few years back and decided to coach cycling. I coached for Breakaway Cycling Team and had a blast. I loved passing along all the skills and lessons I learned along the way. I really enjoy setting up awesome racecourses, which I am fortunate enough to have been able to do over the past few years. I’m currently a firefighter/EMT who loves to ride, run, backpack, and rock climb. Bikes are an amazing thing and can bring people together. Cyclocross is a great avenue to build grassroots and have fun!
